headline: Warner Bros. Discovery to Report Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2025 Results on Thursday, February 26
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. (the "Company") (Nasdaq: WBD) today announced that it will report its fourth quarter and full year 2025 results on Thursday, February 26, 2026 before the market opens. Links to the live webcast of the conference call as well as the earnings materials will be available in the "Investor Relations" section of the Company's website at https://ir.wbd.com/ starting at approximately 7:00 a.m. ET. headline: Exclusive-Netflix has ample room to increase its offer in battle for Warner Bros, sources say
summary: Netflix has ample cash and ‌could increase its offer for HBO ‌Max owner Warner Bros Discovery if rival bidder ​Paramount Skydance ups its own offer, two people with knowledge of the matter said.  The two media giants have been locked in a ‌heated rivalry over ⁠Warner Bros and its storied catalogue, which includes iconic franchises like "Harry ⁠Potter", "Game of Thrones", DC Comics and Superman.  Though Warner Bros is moving forward with a ​March 20 ​shareholder vote on ​Netflix's offer, it ‌has given Paramount a week to come up with a more compelling bid.

headline: Netflix Stock Faces Warner Bros. Discovery Battle And Deal Outcome Risks
summary: Netflix, ticker NasdaqGS:NFLX, is in an acquisition contest with Paramount for Warner Bros. Discovery, with both bids under close regulatory review. Netflix has granted Warner Bros. Discovery a seven day waiver to consider a potentially improved competing offer from Paramount Skydance. Activist investors are urging Warner Bros. shareholders to favor the Paramount proposal, adding pressure on Netflix and raising uncertainty around the final outcome. Netflix shares trade at $77.99, with the...

headline: Justice Department Probes The Impact Of Warner Bros. Sale On Theatre Businesses: Report
summary: The Department of Justice (DOJ) has reportedly summoned a few of the largest theatre chain owners in the country to assess the impact of the potential sale of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. (NASDAQ: WBD).
